description: Gallium is a soft, silvery metal that melts just above room temperature. It is widely used in semiconductors, LEDs, and high-frequency electronics. Gallium compounds such as gallium arsenide provide efficient energy conversion, making them important for laser diodes and solar cells. Though not abundant in nature, gallium is obtained as a byproduct of aluminum and zinc production. Its unique melting behavior and electronic properties make it valuable for advanced technologies.
name: Gallium
